explains: adj. 有实质的；大量的；真实的；独立存在的
n. 名词性实词；独立存在的实体
wordGroup: substantive right 实体权利；基本人权

sentences.en: They plan to meet again in Rome very soon to begin substantive negotiations.
sentences.cn: 他们计划很快在罗马再次会面以开始实质性的谈判。

sentences.en: Although recent censure of corporate boards of directors as "passive" and "supine" may be excessive, those who criticize board performance have plenty of substantive ammunition.
sentences.cn: 尽管最近对公司董事会“被动”和“懒散”的指责可能有些过分，但那些批评董事会业绩的人有充足的实质性证据。

sentences.en: The report concluded that no substantive changes were necessary.
sentences.cn: 报告的结论是，无须作任何重大变更。
